Name.BusinessNameLine1: NATIONAL ASSOC OF BROADCASTERS EDUCATION FOUNDATION

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: The Foundation is dedicated to serving the public interest in supporting and advocating broadcasting issues through education/training, community service, philanthropy, and increasing diversity.
IRS990.MissionDescription: The Foundation is dedicated to serving the public interest
IRS990.Description: CELEBRATION OF SERVICE TO AMERICA - A ONE DAY EVENT THAT RECOGNIZES AND ENCOURAGES OUTSTANDING COMMUNITY SERVICE BY BROADCASTERS AND THEIR COMMUNITY PARTNERS BY MAKING CHARITABLE DONATIONS TO VARIOUS COMMUNITY PROJECTS.

Activity2.Description: MEDIA SALES INSTITUTE - A TEN-DAY INTENSE SALES TRAINING PROGRAM FOR RECENT COLLEGE GRADUATES DESIGNED TO ENCOURAGE PEOPLE OF COLOR TO PURSUE CAREERS IN MEDIA SALES. PARTICIPANTS LEARN THE BASICS OF MEDIA SALES FROM INDUSTRY PROFESSIONALS. AT THE END OF THE PROGRAM, STUDENTS PRESENT MOCK SALES PRESENTATIONS TO RECRUITERS FROM BROADCAST COMPANIES. THE INSTITUTES ARE HELD ON COLLEGE CAMPUSES.

Activity3.Description: BROADCAST LEADERSHIP TRAINING -AN EXECUTIVE MBA-STYLE PROGRAM THAT TEACHES RISING BROADCAST EXECUTIVES SPECIFIC KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS RELEVANT TO OWNING AND OPERATING RADIO AND TELEVISION STATIONS. IT PROVIDES A BLUEPRINT FOR BUSINESSPEOPLE TO BECOME A GREATER PART OF THE INDUSTRY AND INCREASES THE DIVERSITY OF VOICES AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC.

ActivityOther.Description: Additional programs include Education, leadership, career resource and fellowship programs focusing career resource and fellowship programs focusing

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: Grant recipients are required to participate in NABEF programs. Participation is monitored at each program.
